data.title: Very nice, clean hotel.
data.text: We stayed here one night because of close proximity to Colorado childrens hospital. The breakfast was very good, and they even have juice, coffee etc. set up on each floor by the elevator, which is very convenient.

owner_response.author: Brad L, General Manager at SpringHill Suites Denver at Anschutz Medical Campus, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello Carguy58,

Thank you for taking a moment to post a comment on your stay.  We appreciate your business and hope to serve you again soon.

Cordially,
Bard Leonard
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Place
data.text: This is a great facility with wonderful people. We visited for three days while my husband had surgery at UCH. The rooms are comfortable and clean, location can't be beat. First night we lost satellite TV for a few hours, no big deal, staff at front desk kept us informed. The morning we were leaving, all electricity was lost on the corner that the hotel was on. For us, no big deal again, we used out iphone flashlights and the stairs to leave. I hope the hotel got their power back and everyone was OK. I am thankful this hotel is here . Front desk is always great. Love the mobile check in!

owner_response.author: Brad L, General Manager at SpringHill Suites Denver at Anschutz Medical Campus, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Thespina,

Thank you for taking a moment to comment on you stay.  Thank you for you patience and understanding during the power outage.  We appreciate your business and hope to see you again soon.

Brad Leonard
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: An Exceptional Hotel Especially if you are visiting Anchutz Medical Complex
data.text: This is was certainly one of the best hotel experiences I've ever enjoyed.  The hotel is located right across from the Anschutz Medical Campus and runs a shuttle every hour over to it.  Ask for the medical rate if that is why you are staying.   Our room was on the fourth floor, was clean and very generous on space for two of us.  Hotel staff was friendly and helpful.  Beds were very comfortable and surprise! nice pillows instead of the usual 'flat' hotel pillows.  I had the best sleep I'd ever had in a hotel.  The fourth floor was quiet.  Breakfast in the am was adequate including some healthy choices like oatmeal and yogurt.  The shuttle service will also take to a restaurant of your choice within 3 miles of the hotel for free. Would definitely stay here again.

owner_response.author: Brad L, General Manager at SpringHill Suites Denver at Anschutz Medical Campus, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Meredith,

Thank you for taking a moment to post such a great review!  We appreciate your business and hope to serve you again.

Brad Leonard
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: nice room, but noisy
data.text: room was very clean and comfortable, but being on the 1st floor I could hear constant footsteps above me, and there was considerable road noise.  The gym was nice-clean and a decent variety of equipment. Breakfast was good (eggs, sausage, coffee).

owner_response.text:

Thank you for taking a moment to post a review on your stay.  Please accept my apologies for the road noise and the noisy neighbors.  Perhaps next time you come to visit, we can find a more quiet room for you.  Thank you for your business and we hope to serve you again soon.

Brad Leonard

data.title: New and comfortable!
data.text: I love the Springhill Suites, Free breakfast, brand new workout room and rooms designed that allow you to stretch out and relax.  This hotel seems new and conveniently located across the medical center and restaurants in walking distance.   Great rates and very comfortable stay.

owner_response.author: Brad L, General Manager at SpringHill Suites Denver at Anschutz Medical Campus, responded to this review
owner_response.text:

Thank you for the great review.  We appreciate your business and hope to see you again soon!

owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Best SpringHill Suites We've Stayed At
data.text:
We spent one night at this SpringHill Suites and it was an excellent experience.  From checkin to checkout, there were no issues or flaws.  Amazing.

Cassandra checked us in and her service was superb.  She moved our room assignment to something more convenient for us, which was appreciated.  

The room itself was designed well ... clean, spacious, and comfortable.  The split bath (toilet and small sink, and large sink and wonderful shower) was definitely an asset.

The bed was clean and comfortable, and free wifi was great.

Even the complimentary breakfast exceeded the standards of the many SpringHill Suites we've patronized ... loved the scones!

We would definitely return to this hotel ....

owner_response.author: Brad L, General Manager at SpringHill Suites Denver at Anschutz Medical Campus, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Carol B,

Thank you so much for taking a moment to comment on your stay with us.  I will pass your kudos on to Cassandra!  I am delighted you had such a great experience and we hope to see you again sometime soon.

Cordially,
Brad Leonard
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Rude AND they charge for room coffee packets?!?!
data.text: The hotel was clean...but the issue was the afternoon person who was working the front desk was so mean and nasty when we asked for a wake up call and some extra shampoo. Also, we asked for a two extra coffee packets and she charged us! I feel that most of the guests were staying there because they had appointments at the Children's Hospital or the cancer center so to be asked to pay for a cup of coffee was very disheartening, we are dealing with enough....it was just a bit ridiculous and frustrating....The room rate wasn't cheap...come on Marriott you can do better! Another tid-bit the pool only holds 11 people TOTAL

owner_response.author: Brad L, General Manager at SpringHill Suites Denver at Anschutz Medical Campus, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Ann B,

Thank you for taking a moment to comment on your stay with us.  Please accept my apologies for the rude treatment by our team and the size of our pool.  I would be delighted to have you contact me directly so I can better understand your experience and get more detail on what happened.  if you were charged for coffee packets this is not our policy.  Our coffee packets are complimentary and if you were indeed charged, I owe you a refund.  I know your time is valuable but I would welcome an opportunity to  speak with you directly on your experience.

Cordially,
Brad Leonard
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: An exceptional hotel directly across from Anschutz Medical Campus
data.text:
If this had been a full-service hotel (full dining, etc.) it would have received a rating of 5. As it was, it's a great place to stay short- or medium-term. From the beginning, there is ample parking, the lobby, bar, and breakfast areas are large and attractive. The staff at the desk - and throughout the hotel - are all courteous and helpful. On the main (ground) floor is a workout room and a small but ample sized indoor pool (not rated) These are located well away from the rooms and suites, so noise and small should not be a problem.

We stayed in an Executive Suite, which was large, tastefully contemporary, and very well laid-out, with a quasi-separate seating area with L-shaped couch, coffee table, desk and chair. There are separate shower and toilet room, both with sinks. The room has a very quiet small refrigerator, and a microwave. The bedding is very comfortable. A very nice hot breakfast is served near the bar on the ground floor, with excellent food options. There is limited seating, so expect a crowd. The adjacent outdoor sitting area is available where you can eat or drink on nice days.  What really struck us was the excellent cleanliness of all rooms and facilities in the hotel. Bottom line: one of the best hotels we have stayed in.

owner_response.text:

data.title: Beautiful hotel, great location!
data.text:
This hotel is in an excellent location. The service is amazing and breakfast was huge! The rooms were very clean and updated, the pool and hot tub area were clean and fresh as well.

We were able to get a better rate based on our child having surgery across the street at Children's Hospital. Service at this location is excellent :)

Cordially,

General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Noisy air conditioner
data.text:
There were two things that made me put a three star here.

First of all, the air conditioner was really noisy. It took me a while to figure out how to shut it off. The air conditioner itself has a control panel, so naturally one would expect that would where you can shut it off. But no, instead, it's controlled by a little panel on the wall by the entrance.

Secondly, I requested early check in for 11:30am. But the room was not ready when I arrived a little past 12 noon. And the receptionist did not appear to be care at all.

It's my first time to stay at a Springhill Suites. I find the room to be very spacious and new. The layout is quite interesting with a semi- separated area for office. It would be good family, too, except that I did not see a fridge and a coffee maker. The bathroom amenity is very basic. Breakfast was complimentary. No onsite restaurant. But there is a Hyatt right behind it that has a nice restaurant. There is also a Panero bread one block away.

owner_response.author: Brad L, General Manager at SpringHill Suites Denver at Anschutz Medical Campus, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Greetings 908Laura,

Thank you for taking a moment to provide a detailed review on your stay.  Please accept my apologies for my team's effort to accommodate your early check-in request and the noisy air conditioner.  We try very hard to honor early arrival requests but sometimes occupancy levels simply get in the way.  I do sincerely hope to have an opportunity to serve you in the future and perhaps we will have made enough improvement to receive a 5 instead of a 3.  Thanks again.

Cordially,
Brad Leonard
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Close to childrens hospital
data.text: I take my daughter to childrens very often. Every time i need a place i stay here. Staff is very nice and helpful and the rooms are nice and clean and their breakfast is very good. They have a pool that my daughters love of course and the best part is that Childrens Hospital is just accorss the street.

owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Close to hospital, easy access to main transportation routes
data.text:
I had to travel here at the last minute to deal with a relative at the hospital.  

Travel from airport to hotel is clear and simple, takes about 20 minutes.  I had no issues.  Parking was well lit and free.  I did not find any issues with obtaining parking, even though I had arrived in the evening.  Lot felt safe, I was not concerned.

It is easy to reach the hospital from the hotel, which is appreciated.  While it's not "across the street", it's really only a short 5-10 minute walk.  Keep in mind that the main road, Colfax is a major street, use the pedway system to cross.  Do NOT jaywalk.   

Walking along Colfax was also safe, I did not feel concerned even though I walked it alone at 11:30 PM.  There was still traffic and it's fairly well lit.  That being said, if you have a car the hospital does offer free parking.  I admit, the next day I simply drove over.

Hotel felt safe and clean.  It's not a four star fancy establishment but it was quiet, clean and very friendly.  Staff were helpful w/o being overblown about it.  I liked that.

Room was clean,quiet and good enough.  I did like the small cabinet with a fridge and microwave.  Bed was comfortable, if a bit hard.  Nothing was a deal breaker.  Just a standard hotel room.  Better than most.

Overall verdict - it's a nice place.  It's not 4 star but it's far better than say a Super 8.  
If I am in the unfortunate position of needing to stay near the hospital again, I would stay there another time.

data.title: Convenient to hospital, Nice with no major flaws but nothing special
data.text:
I stayed two nights in June 2016 to attend a conference at the Children's Hospital across the street. If you have been to other Springhill Suites you will know what to expect. This is a chain that puts a large meeting/breakfast area in the lobby, a small fitness room, and rooms that try to be hip but are not designed for the best use of the space. Check in was fast and friendly. The room, like all the others in the chain seem to be designed by dropping in a series of modules: desk, bed, bathroom, and a wardrobe. There is a sitting area and desk but the lighting is glaring and not very inviting. There is a little area with a coffee maker and fridge. There is a separate room for the toilet and a small sink. The shower (no tub) is very big with a large glass door. There is another sink across from the shower. The bed is big and comfortable but without outlets in bedside table. I can't believe that no one in this chain has ever stayed in one of these rooms and did not need to charge something. There is an outlet a few feet away from the bed. Another oversight is having a TV that does not face the bed. I guess they wanted it to be visible to the sitting area, but I bet most travelers watch the TV in bed. 

My room faced Colfax which is a very busy road but I did not find any issue with noise. The drapes successfully blocked street light but the gap at the entrance door was so high the bright hall lights bothered me. Fixed it with a towel on the floor of the threshold. 

The breakfast was standard motel fare but not very appealing the scrambled eggs were dry and in tiny little pieces, the sausage was flavorless. Every thing I tried cried out "we're saving money over quality". Stick with the cereal and fruit.

There is free parking behind the hotel but the lot got pretty crowded at times. This place was built recently in an area that is still under heavy development. Just behind that area is a pretty sketchy looking neighborhood so I would not recommend late night jogs out there. 

Would I stay there again? Yes because the price was better than the competition in the area and I could walk across the street (using the pedestrian overpass) to the hospital. It is a clean, slightly upgraded motel like those all across the USA. Like McDonalds it's not great but you know what you will get.

owner_response.author: Brad L, General Manager at SpringHill Suites Denver at Anschutz Medical Campus, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi Brent,

Thank you for taking the time to offer such a detailed review.  I have taken note of your comments regarding breakfast and some of the other items you mentioned and will see what we can do to improve in the future.  Thanks again for your business and we hope to have an opportunity to serve you in the future.  

Cordially,
Brad Leonard
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Stay!
data.text:
I got in at 1 a.m MT, and asked the friendly,courteous clerk to watch my stuff as I parked my car. She agreed, and asked to start my reservation. I found parking quickly, came back, and she handed me my key. I was so grateful!
I stayed in the Executive Suite while attending a conference. The room was clean, and kept clean for the 4 days I was there. Very comfortable bed, nicely decorated, had a refrigerator and a microwave, and a desk for me to work. The toilet was in a separate room from the shower.
The water pressure was good, and the temperature was hot enough.
I was traveling alone, and I never felt unsafe.
Breakfast changed every day, and it was ok. Unfortunately, it seemed as if only one person was working, and things would run out I appreciate the fact that one day they had turkey sausages, I usually have to ask for that.Also, the elevator is soooo slow.:)
The Fitness Center is small 2 treadmills, an elliptical, and a bike. They also had some weights and a bench.
 I had to use the Business Center to print my parking pass, quick and easy.
There were teams staying there, but at no point did I witness any raucous behavior.
My bill was slipped under the door, so all I had to do was drop off my keys.
I would stay here again!

data.title: The Thoughtful Hotel
data.text:
This hotel thought of everything and it shows. Many of the guests are being seen at the medical center or have loved ones who are patients. The staff was kind at every juncture and comfort of hotel guest is obviously a priority. Breakfast was bountiful and the bar was open when we needed it, complete with a lovely bartender. 
Room design was perfect. Maximized the space, sitting area, desk, and could even have a his and hers bathroom.  All I can say is Spring Suites got it right. My only request is, could I get a bathrobe?

data.title: Details...
data.text:
Overall the hotel is fine but they are either under staffed or need to have some additional training for their staff.. We experienced multiple light bulbs that were out before we got there, our thermostat didn't work properly, it was either freezing cold or hot..
The hotel was sold out and the breakfast was not tended too so if you didn't get there right when it opened it was gone and a complete mess..

owner_response.text:

Thank you for commenting on your recent stay with us.  I appreciate you bringing these issues to my attention.  Please accept my sincerest apologies for the apparent shortage of staff.  I will look back over the scheduling model and the staffing to be sure we have adequate coverage for future busy breakfast times.  Thanks again and we hope to see you again soon.

Cordially,
Brad Leonard
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Excellent Customer Service
data.text: We stay here when our daughter is at Children's Hospital of Colorado. It is always clean, comfortable and has a substantial free breakfast. During our last visit in February, there was a huge snowstorm. We were not sure we were going to be able to get home and we were unsure if our daughter would be released that day. The staff was able to secure the room we were staying in and let us stay until we were able to make a decision. We were able to get home but knowing we had a place to stay if we could not leave was a great comfort. I also saw the staff making arrangements for other stranded travelers as well as offering to help dig cars out of the parking lot to get people on their way. It is our go to when we are at Children's Hospital but I would be happy to stay here if we had another reason to be in the area. It is a winner!

owner_response.author: Brad L, General Manager at SpringHill Suites Denver at Anschutz Medical Campus, responded to this review
owner_response.text:

Thank you for commenting on your stay with us.  I am pleased to hear our team came through for you.  We sincerely thank you for your business and hope to see you again sometime soon.

Cordially,
Brad Leonard
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Comfortable, convenient and straightforward
data.text:
We stayed for a short overnight business trip and the front desk staff was friendly, the room was comfortable and the bed was nicely appointed.  I do wish the room had easily accessible power outlets by the bed.  The ones at the desk are not that far away but I needed to check my phone during the night and had to walk over to the office area of the room to access it.

Breakfast in the lobby was pretty straightforward with scrambled eggs, oatmeal and biscuits with sausage gravy for the hot items; cereals, melon, grapes, hard boiled eggs were also available as were a variety of breads and muffins.  I did appreciate the real cutlery and plates (I have a thing about eating eggs on a styrofoam plate).  

Overall, an expectedly pleasant experience.

data.title: Could have been better
data.text:
Our family of 4 stayed here on a recent trip to the Denver area.  I chose it primarily because it was a "suite."  It was nice to have the extra sitting room and extra space, but there were some things about the room that I though were just odd.  For example, the lack of towel racks or even more than one hook!  There is one hook in the room with the toilet (for the hand towel) and one hook in the bathroom with the shower and sink.  Where are the other 3 people suppose to hang their towels.  This one hook was located too far from the shower to be able to reach it from the shower.  Am I the only one that likes to towel off in the shower or does everyone else just step out dripping wet?  It's crazy. Plus when we got to the room there was no towel in the "water closet."  I guess they just forgot but maybe a housekeeping checklist would be a good thing.

The other thing we couldn't figure out was the refrigerator.  We had pizza delivered one night and brought home leftovers another night but the refrigerator didn't seem to keep things cold enough. Drinks were fine in there, but pizza was just a couple degrees south of room temp.  No matter what we did couldn't make it colder. 

They were short on towels when we were there I guess, because they only left 2 towels in our room when we arrived, so I went down to the front desk to get some more.  There was a man there also wanting more towels for his room.  The person at the front desk said they were out of towels and wouldn't have any more until after housekeeping came in the morning to wash some.  She reminded us that this was not a "full-service Marriott."  I did not realize that towels were just for "full-service" Marriotts.  

Breakfast was so-so.  I read a review that said the oatmeal was delicious.  I wouldn't no because they were out of oatmeal all 4 mornings we were there.  Eggs weren't great, and the ham was also yuck.  Waffles were good but they only had them on Saturday and Sunday.  Cold cereal, yogurts, fruit all fine.  Coffee good.

owner_response.author: Brad L, General Manager at SpringHill Suites Denver at Anschutz Medical Campus, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Greetings Beth N,

Thank you so much for taking the time to provide such a detailed review of your stay.  I will share all of your comments with the appropriate team leaders to make sure we correct the deficiencies, including the staffing levels for the breakfast area and the supply of towels we have.  We are in the process of phasing in more towel hooks in the bathrooms so perhaps that project will be complete for your next visit.  Thanks again and we do sincerely hope to have an opportunity to serve you in the future. 

Cordially,
Brad Leonard
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great value. Plus here are some hints/tips!
data.text:
Hotel is conveniently located right off the highway and across the street from the Anschutz Medical Campus and Children's Hospital Colorado.  Loads of parking - no problem.

Rooms are good size, great layout, lots of space in the bathroom with separate toilet and shower rooms, nice size desk for working, comfy couch, good sized TV, and a mini fridge and bar area.  Hair dryer is a bit hidden in the closet -- look closely and you'll see it hiding on the back wall.

Fitness center is a bit small - but doesn't seem to get used too much.

Not too many restaurants close by (a few fast food/fast casual that you can walk to) but area restaurants deliver -- check the list at the hotel, or get an even bigger selection using Seamless (app).

Complimentary breakfast was great -- lots of choices from eggs and bacon/sausage or waffles or hot oatmeal with all the fixings or pastries and toast, cold cereal and yogurt, fresh fruit and of course coffee a d juices. And a really nice breakfast room to enjoy it in.

Only negative: they have a market in the hotel but the prices are REALLY expensive (bottle of water for $3.50??!). Save your money and drive down the street less than a half mile to the Walgreens and pick up your snacks, soda and bottled water for much cheaper and keep things cold in your room mini-fridge.   (If you don't have a car, consider Uber or Lyft (apps) or request that the complimentary hotel shuttle can take you down the street - they will take you anywhere within a few miles of the hotel.)
